revised_title: Ernest John Maskell: A Pioneering Plant Physiologist and Educator
tldr: Ernest John Maskell was a distinguished plant physiologist and educator who made significant contributions to the field of plant physiology. He worked at various institutions, including the University of Cambridge and the Cotton Research Station in Trinidad, where he conducted important research on translocation. Maskell was also a dedicated teacher and mentor, supervising numerous research students and playing a vital role in the development of plant physiology as a discipline. His impact on the field and his dedication to education are remembered through his numerous publications and the lives he touched.
